body:
Hello everyone,

I am working on a tool that displays information about a bitcoin node using RPC. One of the parameters I would like to include is the `uptime` of the bitcoin daemon. Currently, as far as I can tell, there is no way of obtaining such information.

After thinking a bit on how to perform this task, I concluded that the easiest way to do this is to check the modification time of the `.pid` file. This has however the disadvantage that it does not work in Windows because the `.pid` file is not created.

I propose the following solution for your review and opinion about this new command before I work further on this. Do you think this new command makes sense? Please consider it a WIP/PoC as it does not have any error checking.

Here is a sample return from the RPC command:

```
$ ./bitcoin-cli uptime  
{
  "uptime": 696
}
```
and the help function:
```
$bitcoin-cli help uptime  
uptime

Display the uptime of the Bitcoin server.
```

Best regards,
Ricardo Velhote
title: [RPC] Add an uptime command that displays the amount of time (in seconds) bitcoind has been running
